title: Special COVID-19 duty on liquor withdrawn in Puducherry
description: The Puducherry administration has rescinded the 7.5 percent special COVID-19 duty on liquor here, enabling a cut in rates of alcoholic beverages in the tourism-dependent union territory. An official release here on Thursday said Lt Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan approved the Excise department's proposal to bring to close the validity of the special excise duty with effect from April 7. The move would make liquor products cheaper here.

title: Puducherry records 81 per cent polling

title: With high turnouts, polls close in Assam, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry
description: The highest provisional turnout was reported from Assam, where 82.28% voters exercised their franchise across 40 seats for its third phase. In WB, where 31 seats went to polls in the third phase, provisional turnout stood at 77.68% and in Puducherry, where all 30 seats voted in a single phase, it was 81.64%

title: High voter turnout in Assam, Puducherry, Bengal and Kerala; polls conclude in 3 states, 1 UT: Big takeaways
description: Polling for the third phase in West Bengal, final phase in Assam, single-phased in Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Puducherry assembly elections 2021 concluded on Tuesday. The voting began at 7 am across 475 seats in West Bengal, Assam, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Puducherry and ended at 7 pm.

title: Puducherry sees 78% voter turnout at 5 pm
description: Curtains came down on the single-phase Assembly polls in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry at 7 pm on Tuesday. Polling was peaceful across the state and the Union Territory. The voter turnover as of 5 pm was about 78% in Puducherry, officials said. Voting for the lone Kaniyakumari Lok Sabha seat where the bye-poll was simultaneously held came to an end as well. Measures were put in place in polling booths to curb the spread of the coronavirus, such as the availability of hand sanitiser and gloves, and wearing of masks was compulsory.
